1151.content:
Deep in the heart of an Alaskan wasteland, Raven Skye has already set off on her latest adventure. Wearing her thickest of clothing for this expedition, Raven has set off in search of the legendary Ring of Meur, which is said to possess the ability to bend reality to the wearer's every whim.

Her journey was long and hard, one of her toughest challenges to date, but utilizing all of her might and strength, she managed to will herself to her destination.

There she stood, looking into a dark cavern of snow, preparing to compete with whatever she was about to face. However before she could make her way inside however, she noticed something strange in the white snow.

Raven looked down to see footsteps heading into the dark cavern. Clearly someone has already arrived before her in the search for the legendary ring. This was incredibly bad. Raven knew that she had to be the first to retrieve the ring, or else reality would be altered and she wouldn't even know anything about it! She needed to make sure that such power, if it existed, would have to be kept an eye on. No one is to be trusted in this quest.

As she ventured deep into the cavern, with her only source of light being her trusted flashlight, she suddenly heard voices from a distance. Tracking the footsteps deeper into the cave, she noticed that the blinding darkness began to fade. There was no further need for the flashlight as she entered what seemed to be an ancient hall. From the carvings and inscriptions upon the walls, she suspected that she was currently inside some sort of Viking outpost. As she continued to venture forward into the hall, her long trek would come to a halt upon a heart-breaking sight.

Quickly ducking behind a large stone, Raven's path has been blocked by seeing a group of mercenaries crowding around an altar which possibly held the legendary ring. She glanced over the stone as much as she could, without being seen, only to see that the leader of the group was none other than Sofia Valda, her long time arch nemesis who, over the years, had developed a strange and twisted fetish of humiliating her enemies. Raven knew that allowing someone as deranged as Sofia to gain control of a reality-bending ring would be the last thing that the world needed. On behalf of reality itself, Raven had to take action.

What happened next?
1151.title: The Ring of Meur

choices: Sofia exited the cave without noticing Raven.
Sofia caught sight of Raven hiding in the shadows.
11512.content:
Surrounded by her group of mercenaries, Sofia picked the ring up from its pedestal and held it up to the light.

“The ring of Meur. Behold, gentlemen.”

“And how do we know that it’s the real thing? The boss isn’t gonna be happy if we bring him nothing but a fancy jewelry piece.” The lead mercenary said, eying the ring skeptically.

“I’ve studied everything there is to know about this ring” Sofia replied, “Believe me, it’s the real thing.”

“I don’t believe it” The man growled, “for one thing, this was way too easy to f-“

He was cut off in mid-sentence as his body abruptly shrank into his parka, disappearing from view. The other men followed suit, their clothes falling to the floor until there was only Sofia left standing in the middle of a pile of empty parkas.

Sofia smiled, looking down at the ring now placed on her index finger. A mouse crawled out of the clothing that had belonged to the man that questioned her.

“Proof enough for you?” she asked, laughing as the tiny creature struggled to comprehend what had just happened.

“Now we all know this is real. And what’s more, the boss only needs to pay me half your salaries, in addition to my fee, in order to retrieve it.”

Raven was shocked by this turn of events. It was one thing to hear about a ring that could alter reality at the whim of its wearer, but nothing could have prepared her to actually see it being used on anyone! It would be impossible to take on Sofia like this, she decided. Her best bet was to wait until the woman let her guard down, which was bound to happen sooner or later. Raven just hoped Sofia would make a mistake before handing the ring off to whoever she was working for.

Sofia departed the crowd of squeaking mice that had once been her fellow mercenaries and began making her way out of the cave and to the surface. Raven could only hide in the shadows and hope desperately that Sofia didn’t notice her. Given their history, Raven knew if she was caught right now she would probably not be lucky enough to get away with spending the rest of her life as a mouse, and she couldn’t help but feel a bit afraid of the possible consequences that her failure on this mission would bring.

However, as fate would have it…
11512.title: Sofia has the ring

115121.content:
Raven did everything she could to hold perfectly still and blend into the shadows as Sofia walked past. Soon, she could hear the woman’s footsteps fading away as she neared the cavern exit. Waiting a few moments, Raven cautiously made her own way back to the cave entrance. Peering out across the snow covered landscape, she could see the figure of Sofia in the distance, heading away from the cave and into the surrounding wilderness. Fortunately, with all the footprints of Sofia and her men in the snow, Raven’s own tracks had gone unnoticed. It looked like Raven was safe, for now.

Now that she was no longer in immediate danger, Raven began to think about what had just transpired. It didn’t seem to make sense. Sofia had just acquired a ring that could warp reality itself… and she was about to hand it off to someone for a fee? Moreover, it was easily a three day hike through the wilderness to get back to civilization. Instead of hiking, why didn’t Sofia just use the ring’s power to travel wherever she wanted to go next?

Raven decided it would be best to contact Joey ASAP. Having some backup would be beneficial. Joey might also have some insight that would help unravel Sofia’s motives. However, if she took the time to contact Joey now, she may lose track of Sofia.

122.content:
Upon an abandoned island amidst the Philippines lay the mysterious Silver Stone of Size, an ancient artifact renowned for its ability to shrink any living target that the user desires. The origin of this piece of history has remained shrouded for centuries, but it was said that this forgotten relic was enclosed in a stone tablet deep in a dark cave on this forbidden island, or so it was told.

This mystery however came close to its discovery. Already Joey Phillips has entered this secret cave in search of this rare item, and with a formidable enemy immediately on his trail. It was a long trip for Joey, who struggled to juggle fighting off the dangerous allies of his adversary with uncovering the clues to the whereabouts of this ancient relic, but finally, after months of fighting and searching, the mysterious Silver Stone of Size was within reach. He would soon realize what it meant to be famous.

Before he could attain his dream however, he knew that he had to beat his rival in the race for the stone. Not far behind him in this cave was the mercenary named Scarlett Beauregard, better known by her allies as Ruby. Wearing her usual black skin-tight leather jumpsuit, the red-haired woman was in hot pursuit of Joey Phillips.

Joey knew that Scarlett intended to use the Silver Stone of Size for her own personal gain, but as long as Joey had possession of the tiny emerald gem, the only key to opening the tablet that held the legendary stone, he knew that it couldn't fall into her hands. At the same time, Scarlett knew that she needed to take the tiny gem for herself, but previously she had promised herself not to kill her opponent in the process, as she preferred to see him in a much more desirable state.

The chase was rough and treacherous, but finally, after overcoming several deadly obstacles, both Joey and Scarlett found themselves in the presence of the tablet, perched upon a stone altar, under the beam of daylight that crept into the otherwise dark and gloomy area. Ceasing their combat, they both approached the mesmerizing site. The moment of peace however quickly disappeared as Scarlett attacked her opponent and ripped out the tiny gem from his person.

Slightly weakened by the wicked lash that he had just received, Joey Phillips raised back to a vertical stance, only to see his opponent, of whom he had battled with for so many months up to this point, place in gem in the indicated point of the tablet, thus unlocking it. Out of the tablet slipped the legendary stone itself, the mysterious Silver Stone of Size.

Upon the first glance of the artifact, they both flung themselves at the stone, each hoping to become the better of their adversary. One sought to recover the stone and release it to his local museum, while the other sought to use the stone for her own personal gain. The fate of their futures rested upon who would come out of this battle with the stone.

But what happened amidst this moment of tension?
122.title: The Silver Stone of Size

choices: Joey shrinks Scarlett for fun.
Joey makes his escape.
Joey tries to reason with her.
1221.content:
Throughout the struggle, the dust clears. Both have grown tired over fighting with each other for the Silver Stone of Size. It has been quite a notable artifact, and has been protected in the cave.

From all this struggle, someone managed to take the stone in their hand. In his hand, Joey has the stone, finally after wrestling for it with Scarlett. He looks at it and admires how strange its appearance in. Successful with his trip, he knows that he won.

A grin appears on his faces as he looks over to his fallen foe. Her hair isn't in order like before, even her clothes have gotten slightly dirty, as she gives him an angry look.

"I don't know what to say, but I sure do like winning." Joey says with a smirk. "Helps make the job interesting."

Scarlett becomes angry at him. Her foe managed to beat her, even when she tried hard to search for the precious stone. She deserves it, not him, but right now she knows that he will use it for 'good' and 'make sure it's protected from people like her'. That side of him annoys her greatly. "Darn you, Recoil! Every single time you always become a pain to deal with!"

"Aw, how sweet. But you should know to expect that kind of thing from me, Ruby." Joey says to her. "Maybe you should retire before your hair gives out from all the losses you've gained against me. Besides, it might get worse if your negativity attracts the restless spirits here, scaring you to death with spooks and fright." Joey taunts.

"Never, as long as I have you as my enemy, I will always work to ruin that smug look of yours." Scarlett says with a scowl on her face. Clutching the ground, she can't help but feel weak at the moment.

"We'll see about that." Joey says to her as he holds the artifact in his hand.
1221.title: Joey Phillips came out of the fight with the st...

choices: Joey deals with the enemies
Joey stops for a bit to catch his breath
12212.content:
His rival just looks at him with an angry look. She doesn't want to be defeated, yet he managed to prove that he can be a troublesome foe in the long run. "You're always a pain to deal with, Recoil." Scarlett states. "When will you cease your childish meddling and leave me be!"

"Depends on the time of day I guess." Joey says. "That, or maybe when you stop trying to create an evil plot worth putting a stop to."

"Ugh, you're so unbearable." Scarlet says.

"I know, baby. That's just how it is." Joey says as confident as ever. "Now then, I'll be off with this here gem and catch you on another time. Make sure to spot me in the newspapers, I gotta reputation to hold."

Infuriated over her own rival being one step ahead of her, Scarlett just fills up with rage. "Blast you, Recoil! One day I will have my revenge!"

Joey runs off with the gemstone in hand. He doesn't want to waste time with the woman before him. After all, there are more adventures, dangers, and places to see. Dealing her will be one of those days that he's going to have to deal with.

That Joey has done it again, somehow making a fool out of her. From her expertise in being a mercenary, Scarlett has proven to be a great fighter after training hard and mastering different fighting styles to keep her enemies on edge. Often undefeated, Scarlett has chosen to take the fallen enemies under her wing to become strong people to support her, or kill them for their acts against her. To her, it did not matter if her skills aren't recognized that much by many who fear her, for she will prove to be worth being intimidated by when she comes for you or anyone else.

Throughout her years, that has been her resolve, her determination to set a goal and see it through. Yet Joey miraculously finds a way to make her lose her cool. Eventually, that item will be hers, as well as any treasure she sets out for. As he makes his way out, Scarlett takes out her transmitter watch. With seriousness, she says out loud, "Boys, be on the lookout for that wretched Recoil. Take him out, if necessary." Hanging up, Scarlett does her best to get back off the ground. Hopefully she can reach Joey in time and snatch the artifact from his hand.
12212.title: Joey makes his escape.

choices: they talk for a bit
something stops their conversation
12213.content:
He looks at the strange artifact in his hand. Due to the fact that it took him a long time to find and acquire the artifact, Joey finds much to admire from it. Finally, after the short tussle with his rival, Joey managed to get the magical gemstone.

"Finally, after taking on this expedition, I got a chance to see one of the rare artifacts of legend." Joey says. "This rock can be stored some place safe."

"It's not a rock, it's a stone, geez Recoil." Scarlett tells Joey.

Joey looks at the rock and then back at Scarlett. He shrugs at the thought of it. "Looks like a rock to me."

Scarlet is appalled by both Joey and his casual nature. "That's because you know nothing of the adventures you take on. You're just an errand boy willing to head out and risk the trouble in finding something you barely understand."

Joey looks at her and seems shaken up. "Not true, I am just interested in finding the rare things in life that others hope to see."

Scarlet sighs and looks away. "Typical answer from a typical man. I bet you go home to play Phone of Duty with your friends."

"Hey, I'll have you know, that game is popular enough many. It's doing so well." Joey says. "You're probably just a terrible video game player."

"Right, and I bet you're just eager to be like the regular people instead of doing proper research and doing hard work." Scarlett says.

"Like you know more about this than me?" Joey says with a questioning look.

"As a matter of fact, I do. After all, I have spent my time researching hard to find what I want, training my mind and body to take on the troubles that face me, and making partners who will be there to support me in my endeavers." Scarlett tells him. "Unlike you, I devote more than just skill to a trip." She then stops and continues as she tries to get up. "For me, I must overcome the dread and troubles that ail me in order to get stronger, no matter the cost, something you probably deem otherwise simply useless."
12213.title: Joey tries to reason with her.

choices: Joey agrees
Joey ponders in thought
122131.content:
Joey realizes that she's right about what's been going on. In a way, he feels a bit of pity for his enemy, despite her unusual ways. There might be something in her that he could probably understand. "You know what, maybe you're right." Joey says to her.

"Darn you, and you...what?" Scarlett becomes dumbfounded. She becomes confused by his strange words, something he has barely said to her over the course of their history as rivals. This might be a rare and impossible moment, as though it were a vivid dream. "A-are you admitting your faults?"

Joey looks at her and then walks over to a nearby rock. He sits down on it, while staring at the ground with the stone in hand. "I guess so, yeah. Even someone like me has to, ya know?"

Scarlett can't help but awkwardly stare at him. For a moment, she giggles before laughing at his response. "Hah, the Joey I know is much too hot-headed. For you to...wait...why are you even talking to me about this?"

"Dunno, maybe because you're like my exact opposite I guess. I guess the only way for me to open up is to talk," Joey says. He smirks at the thought of it all, him being near her without spending the time fighting or escaping from her. It seems so calming at the moment, yet weird.

"You can be such a fool." Scarlett groans. "A fool that can be reckless and never know what he is truly doing."

"A fool that's willing to learn, though." Joey states.

Scarlett decides to sit down and relax. After fighting with Joey from the stone, she feels a bit tired. "Well Joey, I can't really help you there. Everyone's got problems to deal with on their own, and me telling you about it might lessen the fun."

Joey looks at her with a confused look. "Lessen the fun?"

"This whole cat-and-mouse debacle between the two of us. It's our weakness and our strength." Scarlett says to him.
122131.title: A Mellow Conversation

choices: He was now no bigger than Scarlett's leg.
He was now no bigger than Scarlett's shin.
He shrunk to an even smaller size.
1222.content:
To his distress, Joey Phillips was helpless as Scarlett Beauregard beat him to the punch, and after kicking her adversary in the face, reeling him back a couple of feet away, she grabbed the Silver Stone of Size and pointed it to her wounded opponent. As he panted on the dusty ground, Scarlett grinned. Suddenly the stone glowed with a strange green aura before firing a beam into the heart of Joey Phillips.

At first, Joey felt nothing, and resumed in his attack. Frustrated by the outcome, Scarlett swiftly avoided any further combat in the hopes that the stone would eventually create a turn of events that pointed in her favor. At every possible opportunity during the fight, she fired the strange green light at her opponent while dodging his ruthless attacks.

They were both becoming tired. Fatigue started to kick in as Scarlett was about to throw away the stone in frustration. But during one quick moment of peace, as they both tried to catch their breaths, the effects of the stone finally started to show.

But by how much did Joey Phillips shrink in the presence of his adversary?
1222.title: Shrinking Recoil

choices: She decides to shrink him even more.
She decides to do something else.
12221.content:
The more she fired the mysterious green light from the enchanted stone at her adversary, the more frustrated the user became. But before she would throw away the stone in disapproval, she blasted the light at her opponent for one last time. This time however, the effects of the light started to show.

After a stunning blast from the stone, Joey Phillips was knocked off his feet and momentarily lost consciousness, but as he came back to, he noticed that everything was not as they seemed. He ascended to his feet, realizing that his surroundings were much more distant than he recalled, until he turned back to his opponent, who stood surprisingly tall with a sinister smile upon her face, even though he could barely tell, considering his distance from her face.

As Joey struggled to regain his composure, Scarlett stepped towards her. The closer she came, the more Joey felt insignificant and pathetic to her superior adversary. It was at this spine-chilling moment that Joey came to a shocking conclusion to this incredible turn of events. Now within an arm's reach in front of his giant enemy, Joey knew that all of the rumors about the legendary stone were true, and unfortunately for him, he had to find out first hand. His head was now level with his opponent's crotch. His clothes may have shrunk along with him, but his equipment was now noticeably too large for him to use. He was now merely the size of Scarlett Beauregard's leg!

With this noticeable size difference, Joey struggled to look up into the face of his adversary, with his vision blocked off by the large breasts that hung high above his head. Joey knew that at this size he would not be physical strong enough to overcome his female opponent. In a desperate attempt to escape the wrath of his adversary, he put all of his remaining strength into a single kick against her thick shin. Unfortunately his attempt was in vain, as Scarlett felt nothing but a tiny scratch on her shin, an insignificant sensation that a woman as strong and endurable as herself would not even groan about. Scarlett merely laughed at the feeble attack by her shrunken victim before swiftly lifting her leg and driving her knee straight into Joey's tiny face. The attack was delivered with enough force to knock Joey a few inches away and crash onto his back.

Joey was slightly dazed by the swiftness of the attack, but before he could crawl back to a vertical base, or at least attempt to escape from the scene, Scarlett quickly leaped towards her stunned adversary. She buried her heels on both of her shrunken opponent's wrists, trapping him beneath her ankles, and dropped her buttocks onto his torso, thus rendering him unable to do anything but squirm. All of her weight was pressing down against her tiny adversary, trapping him in a very humiliating positive beneath the buttocks of a woman now over half the size of him.

As Joey squirmed under his captor's butt cheeks, Scarlett looked down on her pathetic victim and laughed. "I'm absolutely enjoying every single moment of this," she cackled sinisterly, "This is child's play! I absolutely adore this stone! Imagine all of the fun things that I could do with it, and think about all the things that I could do to you!"

Feeling as pathetic and insignificant as ever, Joey simply screamed back in retaliation. "You fat cow," he cried, clearly feeling the strain of being crushed underneath the huge, chunky buttocks that his adversary possessed, "You won't get away with this! Change me back this instant!"

Sarcastically Scarlett took a moment to ponder on his demand, ultimately resulting with a denial. "You're intimidation is futile," she laughed back at him, "If there's anyone in this cave that should be feared right now, it's me! You're in no position to threaten me now aren't you?" As much as he hated it, Joey knew that she was correct. As she admired the stone that rested in her hand, Scarlett continued to mock her fallen opponent as she embarrassingly sat on his torso. "This is just too good, but there is just one thing left to do. Now, what should we do with you? I can't just let you go, even though it would be pretty hilarious to see you in the wild at this size, what would be the satisfaction in that? No, I have to think of something much more satisfying to do with you."

Helpless, Joey could only wait in horror for his captor's decision. But in the end, what does Scarlett do with him?
12221.title: Sitting on the Competition

choices: scarlett leaves the cave with joey
joey tries to talk to her
12222.content:
Finding himself with a smaller body than what he normally has, Joey struggles to comprehend what just happened. Right now he has gotten smaller, becoming probably unrecognizable with his new state. Today has become an unlucky day for him.

"I can't live like this!" Joey says in response to the new change. His voice sounds different than his regular and more masculine voice. "Change me back right now!"

Scarlett, still tired from her struggle with Joey, stops looking at her stone and stares at Joey. "Hah, no way Joseph. For so long, you have been like a thorn I couldn't get rid of." She then places her hands on her hips. "Now that you are in such a helpless state, my future plans can go smoothly."

"How am I going to face Rayne now?" Joey says. "Everyone's going to not take me seriously! Even the bartenders will ignore me!"

Scarlett chuckles before laughing at this whole situation. Joey, her long time rival, has finally been bested by his great rival. With him in shame, he can finally realize that she has been an important foe in his life, rather than some random female mook looking for money. "That's funny, you think you will meet her again even."

"What?" Joey says. Judging by Scarlett's statement, things might not look good for him in the future.

"From now on, you'll be my plaything." Scarlett tells him. "You'll have to do it, or I might keep you this way, you little runt."

"No way." Joey says. He then crosses his arms and looks away from Scarlett.

"Oh really?" Scarlett says to him. Although she lost a lot of energy in her struggle with Joey, she then walks over and picks him up in her hand. His small body is easy to capture. "Based on your current situation, you don't have any say in this, do you?"

Joey becomes angry at Scarlett. She's not taking him seriously, like he thought she would. So far everything's unfair as the bad girl won. "You'll regret this, Scarlett!"

Scarlett just scowls at him. His voice became annoying to her as she got close to him. "I never understand people like you, but at some point in time, a great man once said 'Like fuck you, man'."
12222.title: He was now no bigger than Scarlett's shin.

choices: An attractive young woman.
An incredibly obese woman.
Something else.
123.content:
Joey Phillips, an accomplished explorer, found himself in the middle of an ancient temple deep in the heart of the jungle on an island off the coast of western Japan. The forbidden island housed a temple that contained the legendary Mirror of Opposites, which was currently Joey's object of desire.

Very soon he found himself just one stone wall away from reaching his destination, finding one of the most valuable items in the entire world. In anticipation of what he was about to do, Joey reached into his backpack and took out a phone.

"Raven," Joey said on the phone, "I'm almost there. I've almost found the Mirror of Opposites!"

"That's great," the feminine voice replied on the other end of the phone line, "Just be careful. We have no idea what this mirror is capable of."

"I'll be fine," Joey answered to Raven's concern, "I'll contact you when I retrieve it. Joey out." With that said, Joey placed his phone aside and continued his quest.

It was a struggle to open the final stone door, the one door left that was blocking Joey's path to the legendary mirror, but eventually he managed to overcome this obstacle and found himself in a surprisingly light hall. There, in a distance, he spotted a mirror that was the length of his arm, resting upon the crumbling wall in the corner. It was not a tremendous sight to behold, as Joey expected much more from this legendary artifact, but then again, he was not going to complain anytime soon.

Dumping his equipment on the ground behind him, he approached the mirror, seemingly mesmerized by the glistening light that bounced off it. Without thinking, he grabbed the mirror and lifted it from the ground, staring at his own reflection.

But as he glared at his reflection in the mirror, he noticed some minor changes in his appearance. This change suddenly began to alarmingly increase. It appeared that the Mirror of Opposites was living up to its reputation, as Joey began to change in ways that he did not expect.

But what did Joey turn into?
123.title: The Mirror of Opposites

choices: Fountain of Youth
Silver Stone of Size
Golden Statue of Beasts
Voodoo Doll of Possession
Something else
13.content:
Both Raven Skye and Joey Phillips began an expedition.

But what are they in search for?
13.title: Select Your Quest

choices: In their celebration they both slip into the fountain.
Rayne and Recoil carefully bottle the water for testing
They are surrounded by the island's natives who are led by a surprising figure.
131.content:
Joey woke up from a hard night of drinking and fucking with his on and off again partner Raven Skye. She was a cute thing asleep as he was but the hangover coming upon the man was overwhelming he needed an aspirin.

And some water.

"That's why we're here for in the first place." Joey said to himself as he walked around the private boat they rented. Their journey had taken the adventuring couple to small uninhabited island in the Caribbean Sea. It didn't show on most maps for some reason but Raven had found a map storied away in some archive that supposedly belonged to Ponce de León himself.

Downing an aspirin with some bottled water he heard Raven rouse herself from sleep.

"Morning babe." Joey said to her.

"Last night was fun." Raven said, "I felt like some sorority girl a frat party again."

"It was fun but we have work to do." Joey informed her.

"Yeah, yeah Recoil." Raven hummed from her covers.

By mid day, Joey's hangover was in full effect and the couple's journey into the forests of the islands was made all the more uncomfortable by it. The promise of the Foundation of Youth would be unreal to him. Fresh water was becoming a new commodity in the world today and if he could get one that was rejuvenating as the myths said, well that would make him a wealthy man indeed.

He could buy out Scarlett Beauregard's mercenary company so easily. The look on Ruby's face would be worth this struggle through the jungle alone.

"You see that temple ahead right?" Raven asked him.

"I do." Joey replied, "You think its that simple?"

"Let's find out." Raven smiled.

The two soon found themselves inside a temple and indeed they found themselves facing a simple looking water fountain. Large enough for any man to submerge himself in but small enough to fit at the center of the temple's rear end.
131.title: Where Ponce de León Left Off

choices: Raven did.
Joey did.
They both did.
134.content:
Joey Philips was sitting on his chair flickering with his lighter, on and out, on and out. Joey liked to do that when he was bored. And how bored he could get up here, sitting in an old rusty warplane with nothing else to do than just watching out of the window looking at the swam covered tranches which looked all the same to him.

"Would you please stop that?" Raven said annoyed as she watched over the briefs towards Joey. She knew she should not bring him with her, after all this was the typical kind of behavior he would normally do. But as chance would have it, Joey was the only one who knew where the artifact was to be found. And the one thing in return for the information was to bring him with her. As if that wasn't bothering her, the airplane was. This old rusty bucket was near it's end as it was shaking all even from the slightest of winds.

"Relax Rayne, you don't need to read through any of those things. This is a mission like any other, we just get inside, grab the doll and then hike out of there." Joey said as he then began to throw the lighter up and catching it when it falls.

"Please, if it was that simple the doll would be stolen already." Raven countered back.

"But it is, the locals are too afraid to come near it. Afraid it's cursed, we're the first ones to get there in some time. Unless you are afraid too?" Joey grinned.

"There are no things like curses, Recoil. It's just the fear attributed to the unknown."

"I wouldn't count on that Rayne, my informant was pretty scared himself and he was a former wrestling champion." Joey countered back.

"It's just..." Raven wanted to say when she heard the speaker in the back turning on.

"Sorry to intrude like that folks, but we're near the landing zone. Best to put on your parachutes." The pilot said.

Joey put up his thumb as a sign he heard it and also towards Raven knowing she would have to lay her discussion about curses off for a while. They both grabbed a parachute and put them on. They then waited silently for the red light to flicker and when they did Joey opened the door. Raven looked a little scared about it, but that was probably because of the ground they were to land on.

"Come on, a little mud won't do you no harm. In fact, it might do wonders for your skin." Joey said with his usual grin. Raven frowned at that and quickly shoved Joey out of the plane. While Joey was still laughing she jumped after him. Raven looked at the underground, a little mud he said. Well, they were about to land in one smelly looking swamp. Luckily for Raven though she landed on one of the wooden poles that were still standing around. Joey however was caught in the branches of a tree. Raven had to smile at the sight of Joey in his peril.

"Managing so far?" She said as she casually jumped over to the wooden bridge next to the tree.

"Of course, ending up in trees is one of the things I like to do the most." Joey said as he was squirming about to grab his knife.

"So I don't need to help you? Because I really want to get inside now and the only thing keeping me from it is the sight of you hanging like a fool." Raven said.

"Fine, I could use a tiny bit of help. Provided you can of course." Joey said.

"Sure, just hold on to something." Raven said as she grabbed her pistol and aimed it at the branch. A loud bang happened and the next thing Joey knew he was splashing in the swamp.

When Raven helped him up, he was soaking wet throughout his shorts.

"Ah, don't look like such a sourpuss in fact it might do wonders for your skin." Raven said grinning at the sight of Joey liked that.

"No, I don't think so. When you're so handsome like I am, it won't help as much." Joey said as he walked next to Raven.

Raven wanted to say something, but considering they were near their goal she decided to put it off after they acquired the doll.

"There it is." Joey suddenly pointed forward. In the distance Raven could see...a shack.

"That's it? Are you sure you brought us to the right place? That doesn't look like any temple I have ever seen."

"That's because it ain't. Voodoo doll belonged to a voodoo priestess, they don't live in big stone temples you know. Especially in areas like this." Joey explained. Raven gave him a small punch and then headed faster towards the shack. In front of the shack Raven was looking around to make sure there weren't any booby traps. But Joey simple pushed her away lightly and went straight inside.

"Do you know what could happen like that? You could have been killed!" She asked him angrily.

"Relax if that happened you wouldn't be yammering to me." Joey said as he looked around the shack. The place was very musty, it must have not been used in years. A thick layer of dust was covering everything. Joey noticed the table in the middle of the room with a few chairs and a small black box on top of the table.

Raven and Joey both neared the black box and as agreed they both opened the box. Inside it they found a doll made of straw covered in a black dress. Curious someone grabbed it, but who was it?
134.title: Voodoo Doll of Possession

info.brief_description: Explorers make a discovery that change their lives forever.
info.description:
In this TF story, take the role of either Raven Skye or Joey Phillips who both embark on an expedition that could change their lives entirely.

Before getting started however, you must be aware of the characters featured in this story.

Name: Raven Skye
Codename: Rayne
Gender: Female
DOB: May 21st, 1984
Height: 1.63 m
Weight: 112 lbs
Hair Colour: Brunette
Eye Colour: Blue
Hometown: Ruby City, USA
Occupation: Adventurer
Character Base: http://www.jeuxenflashgratuit.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/08/alison-carroll-lara...
Brief Description: She grew up as one of the fattest girls in all of Ruby City. She was the only daughter of a rich family, who died when she was only ten years old, allowing her to inherit their mansion. Throughout the years, Raven lived with her butler, Jonathan, and managed lose weight and become fit and attractive by the age of eighteen. Since then, she had dedicated her life to exploring and discovering the world's greatest treasures in honour of her mother, who did the same thing before passing away. Raven, however, is not very open-minded, and does not believe in certain things such as curses.

Name: Joey Phillips
Codename: Recoil
Gender: Male
DOB: October 23rd, 1981
Height: 1.88 m
Weight: 188 lbs
Hair Colour: Brown
Eye Colour: Brown
Hometown: San Diego, CA
Occupation: Adventurer
Character Base: http://www.cosmomovieawards.com/actors/images/ryanreynolds_blade.jpg
Brief Description: He grew up with a family of mercenaries who hunted for treasure. When he was eighteen, his parents died during an expedition. To exact the death of his parents, he became an explorer, teaming up with Raven Skye, to discover the world's greatest secrets.

Name: Sofia Valda
Codename: Solitaire
Gender: Female
DOB: June 10th, 1978
Height: 1.73 m
Weight: 131 lbs
Hair Colour: Blonde (formerly Red)
Eye Colour: Green
Hometown: Karelia, Russia
Occupation: Mercenary
Character Base: http://www.gran-angular.net/chicas/bianca_beauchamp_latex_negro_impresionante004...
Brief Description: She grew up as a surrogate father after her parents died in a fire when she was young. Growing up, she trained in all forms of combat and espionage. Eventually she became a mercenary, hiring her services for cash. Throughout the years however, she had been a formidable rival of Raven Skye during her expeditions. If there's one thing that she'd love to do more than kill her, she would rather humiliate her as much as she possibly can.

Name: Scarlett Beauregard
Codename: Ruby
Gender: Female
DOB: November 22nd, 1981
Height: 1.79 m
Weight: 135 lbs
Hair Colour: Red
Eye Colour: Brown
Hometown: New York, New York
Occupation: Mercenary
Character Base: http://www.comicbookmovie.com/images/users/uploads/10959/gijoe_scarlett_2.jpg
Brief Description: Similarly to Joey Phillips, Scarlett grew up with a family of mercenaries who traveled across the world performing ruthless tasks for profit. Scarlett was trained under her father's tutelage. Upon the mysterious death of her father however, Scarlett's ambition was to achieve her father's dream, which was to become the most infamous mercenary in the world. However time and time again Scarlett has been thwarted in her attempts by Joey Phillips. She made a promise that one day she would get the better of her adversary, one way or another.

Name: Johannes Heidi Mindman
Codename: Doctor Mindman
Gender: Male
DOB: April 3rd, 1939

Brief Description: A scientist at the Fem-Zo organization, Doctor Mindman was apart of a Nazi family. He grew up to be an intelligent geneticist. Later he moved to the United States and joined the Fem-Zo organization. However he quickly became a popular figure amongst the black market, selling equipment to terrorists and creating new technology without the permission of his superiors.

Name: Stacey Briggs
Codename: N/A
Gender: Female
DOB: November 11th, 1983
Height: 1.67 m
Weight: 108 lbs
Hair Colour: Blonde (formerly Black)
Eye Colour: Blue
Hometown: London, England
Occupation: Actress / Model
Character Base: http://tv.popcrunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/06/taylor-momsen.jpg
Brief Description: Considered by her former classmates as a prima donna, Stacey lived a life of luxury and popularity. Her professional acting career soared when she was fifteen years of age when she was given a leading role in a romance film. Since then, her popularity ranged throughout the rest of America. She was one of the many bullies from the childhood of Raven Skye, but left to return to her home in London after elementary school. She enjoys most of her time attending parties, but also has a tendency of being at the wrong place in the wrong time.

Other characters involved in the story include the Russian War Criminal, Victor Gatsalov, as well as a Costa Rican Entrepreneur, Alfonso Lagos.

Whenever a new character is added, I'll be sure to keep this page up to date.
